title: النَّدْبَة
description: Learn about النَّدْبَة, the vocative of lamentation and grief, using وَا or يَا to express sorrow over loss or pain: وَامُحَمَّدَاهْ، وَارَأْسَاهْ.

notes.title: What is النَّدْبَة?
content: النَّدْبَة is a type of vocative (نداء) used to express grief, sorrow, or lamentation over someone who has died or something that has been lost. It is the voice of mourning.
The المَنْدُوب (the one lamented) is called upon as if present, expressing deep emotional pain. This is used in poetry, elegies, and expressions of grief.
keyPoints: Used for expressing sorrow over death or loss

notes.title: Particles of النَّدْبَة
content: النَّدْبَة uses two main particles: وَا (the primary one) and يَا (can be used but وَا is more common). The particle وَا is specifically for lamentation.
The المَنْدُوب is treated grammatically like the مُنَادَى - it is منصوب or مبني على الضم based on its type.
keyPoints: وَا = the primary particle for lamentation
يَا = can also be used for ندبة
وَا is more expressive of grief
المَنْدُوب follows مُنَادَى rules in i'rab

notes.title: Adding الألف and الهاء
content: A distinguishing feature of النَّدْبَة is adding an ألف to the end of the المَنْدُوب, followed optionally by هاء السكت: وَامُحَمَّدَا or وَامُحَمَّدَاهْ.
The ألف extends the sound of grief. The هاء is added when stopping (الوقف). In continuous speech, just the ألف may be used.
keyPoints: Add ألف to the end of المَنْدُوب
Add هاء السكت in pausing: وَازَيْدَاهْ
Without هاء in connected speech: وَازَيْدَا مَاتَ
The ألف elongates the expression of grief

notes.title: Classical Examples and Body Part Lamentation
content: النَّدْبَة is also used for expressing pain in a body part, as in the famous hadith where the Prophet (peace be upon him) said وَارَأْسَاهْ expressing headache pain.
In Arabic literature, elegies (المراثي) extensively use النَّدْبَة. The great poets composed moving lamentations using this form.
keyPoints: Used for physical pain: وَارَأْسَاهْ (my head!)
Common in hadith and classical literature
Elegies (المراثي) feature heavy use of ندبة
Expresses both mourning and physical suffering

examples.english: Alas, my head! (from hadith - expressing pain)
Alas for me for what I neglected! (Quran 39:56)
